head.title: Reds Trade Milligan to the Indians

hedline.hl1: Reds Trade Milligan to the Indians

block.p: The Cincinnati Reds traded first baseman-outfielder RANDY MILLIGAN to the Cleveland Indians yesterday for a player to be named. Milligan, 31, hit .274 with 6 homers and 29 runs batted in in 83 games for the Reds this season. He spent four years with the Baltimore Orioles before signing with Cincinnati as a free agent in February.
The Reds' general manager, JIM BOWDEN, said that Milligan had requested a trade more than a month ago.

The Cincinnati Reds traded first baseman-outfielder RANDY MILLIGAN to the Cleveland Indians yesterday for a player to be named. Milligan, 31, hit .274 with 6 homers and 29 runs batted in in 83 games for the Reds this season. He spent four years with the Baltimore Orioles before signing with Cincinnati as a free agent in February.
The Reds' general manager, JIM BOWDEN, said that Milligan had requested a trade more than a month ago.

The Reds recalled TIM COSTO from Class AAA Indianapolis to take Milligan's place on the roster. Costo, a 24-year-old infielder-outfielder, hit .326 in Indianapolis with 11 homers and 57 r.b.i. in 106 games. This is his third stint with the Reds this year. (AP) SPORTS PEOPLE: BASEBALL
